entry.title: ROSEBURG MAN CHARGED WITH ASSAULTING A PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICER
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 5:50 a.m. A Roseburg man was charged with assaulting a public safety officer on Saturday night. An Oregon State Police report said at 6:55 p.m. 36-year-old Tyler Moug was stopped for speeding and failure to drive within a lane on Interstate 5 northbound near Metz Hill. Moug allegedly showed signs of impairment...

entry.title: PUBLIC WORKS PLANS TO REMOVE MATERIAL FROM SLIDE
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 4:00 a.m. The Douglas County Public Works Department is following up on Sunday night’s minor rockslide northwest of Roseburg. County Lead Public Information Officer Tamara Howell said that slide was in the 11000 block of Garden Valley Road. It reportedly took place at approximately 8:50 p.m. Howell said both lanes are open...

entry.title: MERKLEY TO HOLD VIRTUAL FORUM AFTER PRESIDENT’S JOINT ADDRESS TO CONGRESS
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 3:50 a.m. Oregon’s U.S Senator Jeff Merkley will hold a live forum for all Oregonians, live on Facebook and YouTube, after President Donald Trump’s joint address to Congress Tuesday night. A release said Merkley is attending the address to send a clear message to President Trump that he fiercely opposes what the...

entry.title: ROSEBURG SCHOOL DISTRICT PRE-K ENROLLMENT IS NOW OPEN
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg School District is now accepting Pre-K applications for the 2025-2026 school year. A district release said all families living within the district boundaries are encouraged to apply now for their child to be considered for placement in the program. To be eligible, children must turn 4 years old...

entry.title: IMAGINE MYRTLE CREEK PUBLIC LISTENING SESSIONS CONTINUE
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 3:20 a.m. Leaders of Myrtle Creek say they are seeking community driven revitalization. Imagine Myrtle Creek is an effort aimed at developing a long-term vision and strategic success plan for the city. A second series of listening sessions is happening this week at the Myrtle Creek Community Center on Northwest Second Avenue....

entry.title: UMPQUA WATERSHEDS RECEIVES AWARD FROM COW CREEK FOUNDATION
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 3:05 a.m. Umpqua Watersheds has announced that the non-profit organization has received a grant award from the Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation in support of this year’s Eastwood Nature Days. A Watersheds release said the funds will provide a unique, week-long experience for area third graders to celebrate nature, environmental education, and...

entry.title: PROVIDING H.O.P.E PROJECT SEEKING DREAM CENTER DONATIONS
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 2:50 a.m. A H.O.P.E. Drug Court graduate-phase participant is seeking to collect clothing, nonperishable food and toiletries that are needed by the Roseburg Dream Center. The Douglas County H.O.P.E. Drug Court program is preparing for their 109th graduation on May 13th at 5:15 p.m. in the Cascade Hall at the Douglas County...

entry.title: STATE POLICE CHARGE MAN IN ALLEGED RECKLESS DRIVING INCIDENT
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 4:15 p.m. Oregon State Police charged a man in an alleged reckless endangering incident on Sunday evening. Information from OSP said at approximately 6:10 p.m. a large pickup was reported as following too closely and speeding on Interstate 5 northbound. The vehicle was clocked at over 100 miles per hour and was...

entry.title: 7 TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITALS FOLLOWING TWO-VEHICLE CRASH
entry.summary: March 4, 2025 4:00 p.m. 7 people were transported to hospitals following a two-vehicle crash on Sunday afternoon. An Oregon State Police report said the accident took place at 12;00 p.m. on Highway 42 in the Camas Valley area. A sedan was traveling eastbound when the vehicle lost traction sliding sideways on the passenger side....

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING FRIDAY NIGHT ALLEGED INCIDENTS

entry.title: THREE VEHICLES ENCOUNTER LANDSLIDE SUNDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 9:20 a.m. Three vehicles encountered a landslide northwest of Roseburg on Sunday night, resulting in two of the vehicles being damaged. entry.title: Trump moves to boost US timber supply and reduce construction costs
entry.summary: President Donald Trump on Saturday signed a pair of actions to increase domestic lumber production, including a directive for the Commerce Department to investigate the possible harms that lumber imports pose to national security.

entry.title: NOT MANY FILINGS IN SPECIAL DISTRICTS ELECTIONS, DEADLINE MARCH 20TH
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 5:50 a.m. Not many people have filed for open seats in the Douglas County Special Districts Election as of March 3rd. Information from County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 223 positions are open. 165 of those seats currently have no candidates. That means approximately 75 percent of the seats have not generated interest....

entry.title: FEW FILINGS IN SPECIAL DISTRICTS ELECTION, DEADLINE MARCH 20TH
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 4:00 a.m. Few people have filed for open seats in the Douglas County Special Districts Election as of March 3rd. Information from County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 223 positions are open. That includes seats for school districts, fire districts, park and recreation districts, sanitary districts, and more. entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER MOVING TOWARDS DISPENSARIES
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Winston City Council will consider moving towards allowing recreational marijuana dispensaries in its city limits, as part of the council agenda on Monday night. In 2015 Oregon legalized recreational dispensaries but cities and counties have the right to decide if they will allow them in their boundaries. In November...

entry.title: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST ANNOUNCES NEW CAMPGROUND CONCESSIONAIRE
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has announced a new campground concessionaire and the reopening of campground reservations. A UNF release said WESTrek Services is now responsible for managing select campgrounds on the forest. This new five-year permit will ensure high-quality recreation experiences across the North Umpqua, Cottage Grove, and Diamond Lake...

entry.title: GLENDALE MAN JAILED FOR WARRANTS FOLLOWING CRASH

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS SECOND RECORD BREAKING HIGH IN A ROW
entry.summary: March 1, 2025 6:15 a.m. Roseburg had a record-breaking high temperature for the date on Friday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 74 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high for February 28th was 71 degrees, set in...

entry.title: Glide High and Middle schools 2024-25 second quarter honor roll
entry.summary: GLIDE — These are the students who were named to the honor roll at Glide Middle and High schools for the second quarter of the 2024-25 school year.

entry.title: Medford casino ruling sparks planned appeal by trio of regional tribes
entry.summary: Tribes from Southern Oregon and Northern California plan to appeal a federal judge’s second ruling last week in favor of a Medford casino.
